info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 7:14AM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 714 AM MST /814 AM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Horseshoe Bend, or 6 miles west of Page, moving northeast at 10 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Page, Horseshoe Bend, Marble Canyon, Glen Canyon Dam, Marble Canyon Airport, Page Municipal Airport, Wahweap, LeChee, Jackass Canyon, Antelope Point Marina, Antelope Island, Trapeze Cove, Antelope Canyon, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Grand Canyon National Park, Lees Ferry, Golliard Park, Vermilion Cliffs National Monument and Lake Powell.
This includes the following slot canyons... Lower Antelope Canyon, Cathedral Wash near Marble Canyon, Waterholes Canyon near Page, Stateline Wash, Labyrinth Canyon and Jackass Canyon.
This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 541 and 556. the Colorado River between river miles 0 and 11. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 532 and 545. State Route 98 between mile markers 548 and 549.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Lee's Ferry Campground, Lees Ferry Campground, Wahweap Campground, Page Lake Powell Campground, Paria Beach Camp Site, Opposite Cathedral Camp Site, Cathedral Wash Camp Site, Jackass Camp Site, Badger Camp Site, Sandbar Camp Site, Soap Creek Camp Site, Ropes Trail Camp Site, Ferry Swale Camp Site, Twin Stripes Camp Site and Lees Ferry Camp Site.
info.instruction: Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN COCONINO COUNTY UNTIL 815 AM MST /915 AM MDT/

area.areaDesc: Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward
